course.title: Cosmology
course.description: This course will introduce cosmology, the study of the large-scale evolution of the universe. Topics include the expanding universe; Friedmann-Robertson-Walker metrics; the evolution of the matter, radiation, and vacuum energy of the universe over time; evidence for dark matter; the Cosmic Microwave Background and its role in determining cosmological parameters; Big-Bang Nucleosynthesis; inflation and how it seeded the universe today; and the formation of structures like galaxies.
course.prerequisites: Prerequisites: Quantum mechanics (Physics 143a/b or equivalent) and statistical mechanics (Physics 181 or equivalent)
